text.p: 4Front Software International Inc said Thursday that it would take a one-time charge of up to $1.2 million in the fourth quarter, due to a Chapter 7 bankruptcy filing of ActionTrac Inc, its partner in a joint venture.
This would reduce fourth quarter net assets and earnings by up to $0.18 per share, the company said.
Net assets per share as of October 31, 1996 were $3.15 per share, including cash per share of $1.12, 4Front said.
The First Call consensus earnings estimate for the fourth quarter was $0.07 per share.
The ActionTrac International joint venture was formed to provide computer help-desk services outside the United States.
London-based 4Front said it believed ActionTrac's bankruptcy would not have an adverse material impact on its help-desk business.
4Front provides help desk support services to both the retail and the corporate market within the UK.
4Front said both of its help-desk activities have recently demonstrated significantly improved operating performances.
Its relationship with computer retailer Byte now generated billings of over $100,000 per month, it said.
